review_title: Depends on which office you go
pros: Great location and benefits, generally open and friendly culture
cons: Depending on the office you work for, some like the student life office can get quite toxic where bosses are more concerned with KPIs and their own report cards rather than students’ and clubs’ growth and learning. Too event focused instead of club development, not sure why certain people join a student life office when they clearly don’t care (or even like) about students at all. Very competitive between clusters. Staff are over-worked year round, work often extends into nights and weekends, no work life balance at all. Colleagues were mostly unhappy.

 A little bit of micro-management at first, but finally all worth it.

Limited career path keep staying there, but the manager is welcome for transformation and willing to teach and train. 
A good place to start your engineer career.

review_title: Great Company for people looking to get a stable and long term career

review_title: Not recommended until there's positive changes to the work environment itself
pros: There are really genuinely a good handful of colleagues and Professors here that makes the cons here bearable. Their understanding nature shines through their speech and their action which makes it really helpful as the days here can be very challenging
cons:
- Constant change in processes makes it very difficult to keep up. The processes here can change on the fly without being formally informed to the team. Considered yourself lucky if you were informed about it. 
- Too many leaders but no leadership. 
- No sense of ownership or accountability within the team which makes the already confusing work place even more challenging to work in. 
- Calls are left without being put on break mode which causes it to be abandoned till it goes to the next available person. Issue was finally caught before I left the place. 
- No one actually follow up with their cases promptly therefore causing delays and complain by users and staffs. 
- No equal access to the Systems across all team members which make our efficient level drop. 
- Not wanting to train new hire even before the new hire was onboarded. One of the seniors went on a rant and decided to not be available on the week when the new hire was onboarded to avoid training them. 
- Using other colleague's name to sign off is a trend for some reason here. I've been caught in such situation multiple times and had to confront them accordingly. 
- Empowerment to make decision. Almost everything had to be checked again and again to confirm there’s no change in process. Get’s very annoying. 
- Trust is very much broken within the team which is the most annoying thing to happen. Do not always assume those who are newly hired into the team are inexperienced. It is not in your right to judge anyone who joins the team. 
- In summary, easily one of the most demoralising place to work because there's no sense of belonging or achievement here.

pros:
Great facilities and location in the city centre.
Gym is fantastic.
You'll love the student culture.
cons:
Management is fraught with its own entrenchment and silos.
Management and leadership are surprisingly slow to adopt best practices.
Faculty takes a really long time to get moving and takes a long time to agree on keeping abreast of problems in student body.
Incentives for employees are horribly designed; many colleagues work hard and are unable to add these ad-hoc projects as part of their evaluation. After a while, people simply stop trying or leave.

pros: I was there in a few months, however, still have lots of good impression. Good Working Environment. People here pay a lot of attention on improving the surrounding such as planning trees, checking air quality. Good social health benefit for employees. Also, there is many privileges when you works here like playroom, fitness, invitations to special events, tickets to take your friends and family to some entertaining areas in a year.
cons: Perhaps the things that make me need to speak is the condition of work in the weekend. As a research engineer, I love research and want to devote my time as much as possible to my work. So, I used to go the laboratory to gather some information and push progress. However, the room is so hot because people turned off the air system (no way to turn on) so it is very hard for me to work and produce qualified report.

pros: Depending on the department you are in, you can influence and provide alot of inputs. I have learnt alot within the one year and have contributed immensely within my scope.  Also city campus location is a plus
cons:
Compensation is very very low for the inputs and value provided. Need to increase the compensation levels to attract and retain talent to achieve more strategic goals.
Titles are inflated; everyone is a manager, senior excutive - unable to grow and lead a team if everyone has the same title within the team. 
Lack of work life balance
Hiring process and salary compensation is not transparent
Alot of bickering and politics

review_title: Great University but bad company culture.
pros: The office location is very strategic and closed to Bugis MRT station.
cons: The turnover rate is extremely high as the company does not provide coaching or anything to help employees in keeping their jobs.  Employees are always bickering and stabbing each other.  Favoritism is highly practiced and policy is not enforced.  The upper management has no consistency on how employees or managers are reprimanded or counseled.   They never speak to the ground staff or even look in their eyes when they walk by.

pros: Nothing substantial if you are assigned to handle administrative duties. Pretty easy to manage and all you need to do is to be present for seminars.
cons: When you are required to mark mid-term papers or homework - these will take quite an amount of time. Also, when you are required to provide consultations for students, you would probably have to revisit your old notes.

review_title: Highly silo-ed environment and corporate culture
pros: Decent investment in talent for the job function I worked in - many experts hired from both the public and private sectors.
cons: Basically every department/school/lab seemed to operate as its own entity due to the management structure or should I say the political structure. When I spearheaded a three-department collaboration, my colleagues said such a thing had never before been done. So much missed opportunity and wasted efficiencies because of this.

review_title: Good benefits, good compensation, so-so work experience. It's an alright place to work but its definitely not Google.
pros:
- Central location, convenient
- Good benefits and compensation
- Pleasant working environment
- Very family oriented; Does not force you to stay back late.
cons:
- Boring work
- People just do the minimum that is required of them
- Lack of innovation
- Management loves to change their minds instead of committing to something

review_title: It was  rewarding experience.  I would join SMU again if I had the opportunity.
pros: The open culture, supportive leadership and great work life balance.  Very collegial environment.
cons: The career paths and succession plans are not very well defined.

pros: If you like to "relax" and are planning for retirement, most departments here offer that environment.
cons: If you are young and adventurous, you may not get the exposure you want because you are very much contained in your own department.

pros: Good work-life balance, close proximity to town, many staff welfare benefits such as gym, discounts, social activities.
cons: Hierarchical structure, low progression, meaningless work

pros: Everyone has their own special place in the company. Great culture too; Lots of team events. People are willing to go out of their way to help one another.
cons: If there was any cons, it would be – Very hard to leave the job! haha. everyone works well with everyone that you look forward to work every day.

review_title: A Great Place to Work, Teach and Study
pros: Creative and Innovative Environment to teach and do research. Wonderful Deans and Fellow Colleagues. Wonderful group of students and post graduate students who excite and motivates us who supervise and teach.
cons: A specialty university that is rather limited in it fields of study and research

pros: President is great, engages entire community thru townhalls regularly.
cons: Supervisor and RO weak in staff engagement and old skool thinking-leadership style, resulting in poor team communications. Work politics is heavy.

pros: smart people, higher salaries compared to other universities (so I have heard), good locations
cons: All about publication in the top tier journals (FT45), and nothing else matters. Feels like working at a publishing company, rather than academia. Universities shouldn't be like this. (speaking only for biz school). Heard other schools are ok.

pros: The Uni is always cognizant of the need to remain relevant, look ahead and most importantly in wanting to give back to society. Awesome colleagues and leaders who've made my stay here an engaging and fruitful one. Great work-life balance too.
cons: Not all staff / offices might share the same need / desire to maintain an acceptable level of service excellence to both fellow colleagues and students.

review_title: Reputable employer brand. Excellent employee benefits.
pros: Good work-life integration. City location walkable from five (5) MRT stations - Bras Basah, City Hall, Bencoolen, Bugis And Dhoby Ghaut. Excellent employee benefits.
cons: Don't really think there are major cons.

review_title: Not the best company to work in
pros: Decent package benefits but lacking in base salary, good location.
cons: Old school working style, lots of miscommunication, staff are lack of motivation to do their job and always try to push work to others. New president isn't seeing the full picture of the company. Totally no job progression.

pros: Informal, people are addressed by first name. Many opportunities to attend talks on a variety of topics. Location in town is excellent. Clear direction as a business university.
cons: Education is seen as a commodity. Difficult to progress because structure is flat and business titles are not easily understood by outsiders. Professors are acknowledged as experts first, professional staff take a backseat.

pros: Great environment with room to grow. Great people with drive to work with. Very competitive culture which could be a good thing.
cons: Too corporatised. Erodes the idea of learning in school.

pros:
60 days of Medical Leave (including 15 days for Outpatient Sick Leave, or up to a total of 60 days if hospitalisation is necessary) are granted per annum.

Other leave which staff members are entitled to (where applicable) are Matrimonial Leave, Maternity Leave, Paternity Leave, Childcare Leave, Child Sick Leave, Birthday Leave, Examination Leave, Bereavement Leave, etc.
cons: mostly contract basis for now

pros: The flexible benefits and perks are very attractive. Medical coverage and claims applicable for employee, spouse and children. Central and convenient location with alot of food choices in the area.
cons: Slow increment and difficult to rise up the ranks. Unreasonably short lunch duration that no one follows. Management and organisational structure has been undergoing some changes, uncertain times.

review_title: Amazing place to work with diverse experience
pros:
1. Good salary.
2. Lot of benefits like Medical insurance, AWS (Annual Wage Supplement), Yearly bonus, Flexible benefits, etc.,
3. Located in the heart of the city.
cons: 1. If unprepared, it would be really difficult to balance your work with your daily life schedule and at times people may succumb to stress.

pros: Great faculty that support their students very well. My advisors are extremely supportive and helpful. The culture is intellectually engaging and collegial. The students are awesome to teach and mentor.
cons: Security around here can be tight, and it can be difficult to gain access to printers and rooms when needed, especially during peak periods.

pros:
The benefit is above average, general compensation is pretty market rate
good work life balance, great branding of the university
cons:
it is a pretty hierarchy environment,  therefore there would be less freedom to conduct projects or initiatives
meanwhile the structure is quite stable which means there is less progress opportunity,

pros: Location is great - very near to City Hall MRT. It is a young university among three national universities in Singapore and there are still opportunities to grow...
cons: A lot of research pressures as well as for teaching

review_title: Nice company to work, low salary
pros: Nice work as research engineer, good work-life balance other than times when nearing the paper submission deadline, professors are friendly and will guide our work.
cons: Low salary, no career progression, reimbursement take long time.

pros:
This university has schemes that are pro-family such as part-time work etc.
There were also various schemes to try and encourage work-family balance for its members and staff.
cons: Not available for all departments - as it was often dependent on the faculty/ department that requested for it.

pros:
Everyone I met in all departments are lovely to work with
I feel supported by my team all the time.
cons: Being a non-commercial organisation the pay isn't as high as a MNC would pay but competitive in the higher education industry

review_title: Great work environment. Progression for selected few though
pros: Great place for people with young family.
cons: May not get career progression and recognition even if you are a performer. Salary is not the same for same rank despite more KPI for the lesser paid.

pros: It is very high tech and highly facilitated with friendly environment as well as flexible work hour
cons: during the year i was working there, In didn't see any downside in my career except sometimes I had to work at weekends.

pros:
General good working environment.
Attractive benefits.
cons:
General poor management. 
Outdated in terms of processes and technology. 
Reactive approach to problems, and very slow reaction time

review_title:
very good university. 
People in SMU are quite nice and it's easy to approach them if you have any questions
pros: good professors, good curriculum, good internship providing platform
cons: so competitive and too many stuff to do

review_title: Work life balance a plus at SMU
pros: Work life balance, adequate benefits, fair remuneration and performance bonus.
cons: Technology adoption is a little slower than necessary, remuneration is not above average

pros: Great professors with clear research scope. Good salary being research assistants and helps with learning.
cons: Some parts of the job may be repetitive.

pros: Surrounded by some of the brightest people in the country/region! Well-varied research areas.
cons: Not that I can think of but reimbursements can be made quicker.

review_title: Not a bad place to for a fresh grad
pros: Not a bad place to for a fresh grad to start their career.
cons: career progression is slow and annual bonus and increment is limited.

pros: Good employee benefits, great working location!
cons: Unit managers need retraining in leadership skills to learn to motivate staff and not demotivate. Lack of transparency in how career progression can happen.

review_title: Great working environment though compensation can be improved
pros: Great and fun colleagues. Performance bonus ranging from 1.5 to 2.5 months. But research work has been fun.
cons: Compensation is slightly lower than what I can get outside.

review_title: people are slack. work process is quite slow
pros: work load is not heavy. flexible schedule. nice bosses
cons: underpaid. the HR will not consider about your experience. they just set the salary basing on their own limit.

pros: Good employee benefits, good working environment, treated with respect
cons: Maybe stressful, depending on which department you worked in

pros: Good boss, colleagues. Nice location and environment. Many events and workshops for staff to attend.
cons: Quality and attitude of HR can be improved

review_title: Work life balance and fun environment
pros: There's work life balance and lots of staff perks and environment is relaxed and fun.
cons: Low salary and no chance of progression

pros: standard salary based on job title and experience, flexible working time
cons: hard to stay for a long time

pros: Alot of projects and hands-on learning, improved greatly in terms of communication skills and confidence
cons: Brand name isn't as great as NUS or NTU

pros: Caring and dedicated professors. Great central location, accessible campus. Friendly graduate community.
cons: Not an extremely reputable research university relative to other local unis.

pros: A broad range of course provided, Group projects, Interactive Environment, knowledgeable Professors, Friendly Staff, Latest Technological Tools.
cons: Fast Paced Learning Environment System

pros:
-Workload was very manageable (depends on the module though)
-Reasonable pay
cons: Nothing that I can think of (but again, depends on the module).

pros: Established local and overseas presence; situated in town, easily accessible to other areas.
cons: Costly living expenses: meals (within premise and without).

pros: Friendly atmosphere. Great colleagues. Good, inquisitive, students.
cons: High teaching load. Challenging to find a good work/life balance.

review_title: I cannot ask for more as a phd student.
pros: great support from school for phd students
cons: I cannot really think of anything

pros: Friendly Culture, mostly nice people.
cons: Slow career progression, non-transparency on certain things

pros: Flexible Work and low stress environment
cons: Exit opportunities that are favourable beyond the industry

pros: nice place to do research and to earn some money
cons: Nothing was actually cons, per se

pros: Excellent compensation and some excellent colleagues
cons: Management tends to make up the rules as they go along.

pros: Amazing university, easy going culture and a lot of freedom to progress
cons: Might become bureaucratically intensive and complex

pros: Flexi time and big bonuses
cons: Low base salaries and low-pace environment

pros: good management skill, location is great
cons: competitive, libraries are often packed

pros: Timing is flexible which you can plan to suit your academic schedule
cons: No cons that I can think of.

pros: Good pay for students, also pretty chill working culture
cons: Not much diversity in doing paperwork everday

pros: Good city university with generous research support. Student quality is also good.
cons: Still young university. Business oriented

review_title: Safe place to work, quite alot of bureacracy
pros: Good benefits - Gym, Pool, Insurance,
cons: Bureacracy, Red Tape, processes, risk-adversity

pros: Professional scholars from all of the world.
cons: The air condition is too cold in classroom.
